content: design by amanda brown © brown house of maple voyageur toque whether you re paddling a canoe trading beaver pelts for credits at the fort store or just braving the winter cold this hat is sure to keep any voyageur warm this toque pronounced like took is knit in the round but may be made flat and sewn up later if desired materials 1 skein of premier yarns wool worsted 100% wool 186 yds 100 g in pasha red set of 5 size us 8 double-pointed needles directions gauge 19 s x 24 r = 4 x 4 size adult medium 19 circumference fits up to a 22 head adult large directions in parentheses 21 circumference fits up to a 24 head directions cast on 84 92 stitches divide evenly onto 4 needles join into a round and work in k1 p1 ribbing for 3 3 ½ then work in stockinette stitch knit all stitches until the piece measures 5 ½ 6 ½ long decrease round k2tog knit to last two stitches on needle 2 ssk k2tog first two stitches on needle 3 knit to last two stitches on needle 4 ssk next round knit around repeat these two rounds until 4 stitches remain cut the yarn leaving a 6-inch tail draw the tail through the remaining four stitches pull tight weave in tail and cut also weave in tail at the beginning of the hat make a tassel and attach to the point of the hat with a twisted cord voyageur toque page 1 of 1
